WRITING.TEXT: We [broke](https://twitter.com/#!/TrentOster/status/180059313858035715) it
No worries, it's a fair question :-) I wondered myself whether to put it in there.

Love the peat :-) Getting to enjoy a few others, particularly highland whiskys, but always go back to the peat. If I had to name one favourite, it would be Lagavulin 16yo, closely followed by Ardbeg 10. Lagavulin is like drinking warm, gold, satin. So smooth

Yeah, I just love the Kraken bottle; whilst it's primarily a whisky collection, I want it to look good in the living room, and that's a nice bottle to have at head height (Besides, all the whisky is in boxes alas, though they are nice enough)

They're all different Lagas: Distillers editions 2009, 2010 and 2011, and a botle of standard 16yo. THough I pick up 5 bottles of the 16yo last year for around 28 each (Normal prices of 44 or so) due to a price mixup at the supermarket :-)

Nah, those are the ones I'm saving for special occasions. Got my [drinking stash](http://i.imgur.com/V0gFC.jpg) seperately. Most of the drinking stash has got a about a 1\4 of bottle left. The only one that's hidden behind those on that shelf is some godawful whisky (Connemara) I bought in a Spanish border town last year.
I can heartily recommend you try and get hold of some [David Goodiss](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Goodis), esp The Moon in the Gutter Nightfall - excellent noireseque story telling.

WRITING.TITLE: Finally got me a whisky cabinet! Now to get enough whisky to justify getting a second...
Finally tidied a thousand trinkets from my bookshelves, so I can just see the books now. Bit of re-arranging to do, but coming along nicely

probably [Dead Can Dance, Host of Seraphim](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJhVM930YXY), for me anyways!
Not heard of either of the two you mention, but will give 'em a listen now
That's "move", of course, but I can't seem to edit posts using Blue Alien
Cypress Hill - Make a movet. I always sing one of the early lines as "keep you prisoner in the temple of cheese"
Exactly. If you lend someone $10 and never see them again, it was worth it
I read your name as Chloroform Seller, which made even more sense
Seemed quicker to me than using imgur, maybe some precaching being done?
Oh cool, I should even have one of those cables knocking around the place. Will try it out and report back. Cheers!

WRITING.TITLE: Media box - Projector cabling. Converting from RGBComponent\HDMI, to VGA(D-sub)\S-video
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello techsupport peeps! I'm hoping this is the right sub-reddit to ask this question, but please point me in the right direction if not.
I'm trying to rig together a home cinema using bits and pieces I have. Namely a [Hisense media box](http://www.tracyandmatt.co.uk/blogs/index.php/hisense-1080p-hd-media-player-review), and [BenQ MP620p](http://www.aboutprojectors.com/BenQ-MP620p-projector.html) projector. The media box has outputs of HDMI and RGB component out, and the projector has inputs of VGA (D-sub connector) and S-video. All I've read indicates that whilst boxes can convert from HDMI to VGA, there is some loss of quality. I've half a mind to buy a new media box that has VGA out, but just wanted to get another opinion on how easy\impossible it is to connect these two devices, and how to go about doing so if it was possible\advisable.
Note, I'm not running anything higher than XGA resolution if that makes a difference.
Thanks in advance :-)

Indeed; I actually noticed that rogue apostrophe just after posting, but couldn't work out how to edit my post on Blue Alien on my iPad.
Saying that, my art and hand\eye coordination skills are second to, well, just about everyone, so correct grammar would be the least of my client's problems were I to open a tattoo shop :D
Then you, too, can do tattoo's
Yeah, this created a [shitstorm](http://www.guardian.co.uk/media/2010/may/05/danny-dyer-zoo-magazine) a few years ago
I drove over it last summer; I had the Tron Legacy soundtrack prepared in advance, track 4 in particular. Epic crossing!

I was drinking this last night :-) along with Glenkinchie, Dalwhinnie, Highland park 21 and a few others (my partners dad's pressies)The extra strength over standard HP really makes this one. You'll love it I'm sure.
Not just they, but Terry Pratchett says that.

I've got a Glencairn glass, but I much prefer my Talisker rocking tumbler a friend gave me: http://i.imgur.com/9FZuU.jpg
Beautiful to hold, and solidly made too. I do use the Glencairn ones with a new whisky, but by and large I use the Talisker one, sometimes even for Talisker!
Here's a pewter goblet I use for Ale, and also whisky occasionally: http://imgur.com/XaQrT (Alongside a 20cl Lagavulin distillers 2007 which I've been enjoying recently)

I walked past a shop 2 mins from Victoria earlier this week, sold cigars, pipes and hipflasks. Sure they have some funnels in the window, not sure if for with flasks or they were selling them separately. It was on Victoria street, but can't recall exactly where - near McDonalds though

I queued up for the London showing earlier this year, got to box office for 8 am, queued for 2 hours and got front row seats @ 20 each. They only sell the front row seats on the day, so they never get booked up in advance, which is great for the real fans

No experience, but I found a recipe for [whisky and ginger cake](http://www.localfoodchannel.tv/video/2011/09/cooking-with-whisky-video-recipe/) recently, which I'm determined to try! I'll probably use Talisker, for that added spiciness, or Lagavulin if I'm feeling decadent.
In a Laphroaig newsletter, they mentioned some recipes using their whisky - Laphroaig marinaded chicken, that sort of thing. Sounded good, but I didn't see a recipe

At a guess:
TD-S: Talisker Distillery, Skye
5MY: Hmm, not sure but perhaps 5 minimum years, referring to the age of the youngest cask used, but not likely - usually the bottle would pronounce the oldest contents most prominently
Feedback after you open it please :-) I'm sure you'll enjoy!
Never heard of this, but bookmarked this because it does sound entertaining

I knew my Norwegian, pewter, Viking style goblet would come in useful! Picked up two bottles of a nice heather ale to inaugurate it with (It's been sitting boxes on my shelf for a year).
I'm working, but from home tomorrow, how can I justify having a breakfast ale when the postman (hopefully) turns up with my game?

If I'm honest, just about everything that Minsc said. Ever.
"Ahh... We are all heroes; you and Boo and I. Hamsters and rangers everywhere, rejoice! ".
Also Noober from BG1 (Didn't he have a twin in BG2?). Well, I say he was amusing, but the most amusing part of his involvement was when I knocked him unconcious.
edit: also some of the stuff that Lilacor came out with. Comedy gold! "You know, I was a Moonblade once."
"Yep, that's why cars have bumpers" - said to a colleague of mine in France for the day on business, when his driver just nudged other cars out of the way in a car park.
Likewise, just got myself some Lagavulin, 2007 distillers edition, for opening day of this fine game :-)

Very much this; I enjoy the ceremony almost as much as the delicious scotch. It's like a Scottish version of the Chinese Tea Ceremony.
The sound the cork makes when removing the top is indeed a satisfying *pop*
So do you agree with being caned in school? Coz I was always well caned at school, innit
My team is usually Norfolk N Chance

Not Aberlour, but....Whenever I do the weekly shop, I checkout the whisky aisle for any special offers. A couple of months back I noticed Lagavulin 16yo for 28 a bottle (approx $44); usual price is around 42 ($67). There wasn't even a special offer; I figured someone had priced it incorrectly.
I bought 5 bottles, quick sharp, leaving a few behind, and then posted on a whisky forum (whiskymag I think), about it in case anyone else wanted in on the offer. Checked back a few weeks later, and price was back to normal.
By far the best deal I've seen on one of my favourite whiskies, and I still put it down to a pricing error!
Last best offer was a bottle of Laproaig at 20 (Usually 30 or so), which cheered me up too :-)
Hell, I find myself pressing a mental spacebar IRL; I'll be at a bar, and someone asks me what I want to drink: Quick, press mental spacebar to have time to decide!

[XP boost Spoiler](/s "Yep, there is a cave, although the one I know is west of Beregost, where you can repeatedly kill golems for 2000xp a pop. Need magic weapons to harm them though, and they'll still probbaly murderise a low lvl party. This cave is fairly near where the sirens (or whatever they're called, it's been about 6 years since I've played) live")
I agree with Lavaburst though; if it's been that long since you've played, you should be able to enjoy all the interactions and simple pleasures of being fearful for your life when you see a pack of kobolds. Take your time, and enjoy it all
Well I've bought a bottle, but yet to open it. Haven't tried it anywhere else yet either, I just loved the sound of it. Saving it for a rainy day.

I actually got two bottles of it via the Bladnoch distiller forum online shop; so whilst it's Caol Ila, it's bottled by Bladnoch. I drank one bottle and have the other one stashed for the future; incredibly smooth, the smoothness of Lagavulin but less of a kick. Was a while ago I last tried it, so difficult to describe it any more really.
They don't appear to have any at at the moment, but they often have a few older bottlings at great prices - worth checking out. [Bladnoch forum bottlings](http://www.bladnoch.co.uk/acatalog/bladnoch-forum-bottlings.html)

* Isle of Jura 10yo * Isle of Jura Superstition * Laphroaig 10yo * Laphroaig Cairdeas 2010 * Ledaig 10yo * Ardbeg 10yo * Bruichladdich Rocks * Ardbeg Uigadeal * Ardbeg Corryveckan * Lagavulin 12yo (2010) * Caol Ila 25yo * Highland Park 12yo * Caol Ila Distillers Edition (1996) * Lagavulin 16yo * Chieftains 12yo (1998, Ardbeg) * St Georges Distillery Chapter 9, 3yo * Laphroaig Un-Chillfiltered 9yo * Ardbeg 1990 / Airigh Nam Beist * Longrow CV * Bruichladdich Organic 2003 * Bruichladdich - Port Charlotte An Turas Mor * Elements of Islay CL1 * Ardbeg Alligator * Elements of Islay LG1
recent empties which I need to replace Caol Ila 12yo, Talisker 10yo, Laphroaig QC, Highland Park 16
In my 'to get' list are: Ardbeg Supernova, Bruichladdich\Port Charlotte PC8, Laphroaig 10yo CS (Cask Strength), Elements LG2, AR1, AR2, LP1, LP2, Highland Park 18, Bruichladdich Octomore, Bruichladdich Peat, Bruichladdich Waves

Now that sounds like the way my collection is heading. Definitely an Islay head head here, but haven't managed to justify getting an Octomore or Supernova yet. How do you rate these two? I'm surprised to not see a few more Lagavulin's in your collection though, or does that mean you've just finished them off, and haven't yet replenished? :-)
Lovely looking collection!

Poor kid, he's clearly afflicted with having passive-aggressive parents. Not only are they likely to be whiny bitches, but now they're teaching their kid that the best way to resolve issues is via whiny fake looking notes. If they do have kids,, they should man up and come round face to face to ask you to be quieter.
Haha, one of the first things you hear in the game! Ah Candlekeep, what carefree times they were.
Know what you mean; only wish there was a way I could erase the memory of them so I could enjoy all over again. As it is, I'll wait a few more years and then reply from the beginning :-)
Don't think it is actually; the Big World project sounds even bigger. Will have a read - not heard of it before!
Magic is impressive, but now Minsc leads....Swords for everyone!

Once you've got them, play through BG1 TOTSC with the BG2 engine (high resolutions, addition of sorceror char etc), using [BGTutu](http://www.pocketplane.net/mambo/index.php?option=content task=blogcategory id=143 Itemid=98)
So. Much. Fun.

Talisker also do an awesome [rocking style whisky glass](http://www.whiskyundspirituosen.de/shop/images/Talisker_Tumbler_Glas_1.JPG). I've got some glencairn glasses too, but much prefer the Talisker one; feels so nice to hold. You can get gift packs with the glass and a bottle of 10yo.
On Whiskies though, there are a few taster collection packs you might be interested in. Not sure where you are in the world, but the Whisky Exchange in the UK has a [coastal malts collection](http://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/twesearchresult.aspx?q=coastal) along with an island and islay one too I think; all of these three will have some similarities with Talisker (The coastal one includes the standard 10yo)
